*{{flag|Australia}} â On 25 March, Australian foreign minister [[Kevin Rudd]] said: "we are deeply sceptical about the official explanations as to what has happened with the various killings which have occurred in Daraa .... And we call directly on the Syrian Government to exercise restraint in their response to peaceful protest seeking democratic change."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/pm/content/2011/s3174118.htm|title=Australia advises citizens not to travel to Syria|author=Alexandra kirk|date=25 March 2011|publisher=abc.net.au|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref>
*{{flag|Australia}} â On 25 March, Australian foreign minister [[Kevin Rudd]] said: "we are deeply sceptical about the official explanations as to what has happened with the various killings which have occurred in Daraa .... And we call directly on the Syrian Government to exercise restraint in their response to peaceful protest seeking democratic change."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/pm/content/2011/s3174118.htm|title=Australia advises citizens not to travel to Syria|author=Alexandra kirk|date=25 March 2011|publisher=abc.net.au|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref>
*{{flag|Canada}} â On 21 March, Canadian Foreign Affairs Minister [[Lawrence Cannon]] stated: "Canada deplores the multiple deaths and injuries following protests in several Syrian cities over the weekend."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jj7uSbIAaro1v0fwW4jziIxQ1j9w?docId=CNG.a807bd69f3debaa7a6b4ca2383f9500b.1191|title=Canada condemns violence in Yemen, Bahrain, Syria|publisher=AFP |date=21 March 2011|accessdate=22 March 2011}}</ref> On 24 April, Foreign Affairs advised Canadians not to travel to Syria, and for those in Syria to consider leaving by commercial means while these were still available.<ref>{{cite web | author=Foreign Affairs and International Trade Canada | title=Canada Condemns Violence and Offers Consular Advice to Canadians Regarding Syria | url=http://www.international.gc.ca/media/aff/news-communiques/2011/126.aspx | date=24 April 2011 | work=international.gc.ca}}</ref>
*{{flag|Canada}} â On 21 March, Canadian Foreign Affairs Minister [[Lawrence Cannon]] stated: "Canada deplores the multiple deaths and injuries following protests in several Syrian cities over the weekend."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jj7uSbIAaro1v0fwW4jziIxQ1j9w?docId=CNG.a807bd69f3debaa7a6b4ca2383f9500b.1191|title=Canada condemns violence in Yemen, Bahrain, Syria|publisher=AFP |date=21 March 2011|accessdate=22 March 2011}}</ref> On 24 April, Foreign Affairs advised Canadians not to travel to Syria, and for those in Syria to consider leaving by commercial means while these were still available.<ref>{{cite web | author=Foreign Affairs and International Trade Canada | title=Canada Condemns Violence and Offers Consular Advice to Canadians Regarding Syria | url=http://www.international.gc.ca/media/aff/news-communiques/2011/126.aspx | date=24 April 2011 | work=international.gc.ca}}</ref>
